name: Pink Lemonade Cheesecake
author: Misskaoz
summary: Sweet and tart flavors. Your friends will love this pie. Big hit with kids especially.
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package fresh strawberries, hulled and thinly sliced
½ cup frozen pink lemonade concentrate, thawed, undiluted
2 drops red food coloring, or as needed
directions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Place strawberries in a covered container
Coat with 1 tablespoon lemon juice
Add 2 tablespoons sugar and shake to coat
Place in the refrigerator
Save remaining lemon juice for another use
Combine graham crackers and melted butter in a bowl
Mix until evenly moistened; press into the bottom and sides of an 8-inch pie pan
Bake in the preheated oven until crust is firm, about 10 minutes
Remove from the oven and cool
Meanwhile, beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until foamy
Gradually add sugar, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form
Combine cream cheese, lemonade concentrate, lemon zest, and salt in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until creamy
Add egg yolks, 1 at a time, blending well after each addition
Gently fold egg whites into the cream cheese mixture
Add food coloring until mixture is the desired shade of pink
Pour into the prepared pie crust
Bake in the preheated oven until set in the center, 25 to 30 minutes
Set the pan on a wire rack, and allow the cheesecake to cool at room temperature, about 1 hour
Refrigerate until completely chilled, at least 2 hours
Cover with the sliced strawberries
Chill 1 more hour before serving
